item.title: Weekly Progress Log - Week 1
item.description:
Week starting: 12th Jan 2026

This week marked my return from a much-needed break spent doing the highly advanced technique known as touching grass. After a busy year, I came back feeling relaxed, refreshed, and in a surprisingly good mental state.

Instead of easing in gently, I decided to jump straight back in and see how rusty I‚Äôd become.

Took me a whole 2 hours to remember the master password to my password manager before I could log in anywhere. Never change your password before a long break. I didnt even remember why I changed it in the first place.

item.title: Behind the Mayhem: My PerfectRoot CTF 2025 Recap
item.description:
üéâ Lights, Camera, Chaos!

If you heard loud keyboard smashing on the weekend of December 5th‚Ä¶
yeah, that was probably us.

PerfectRoot CTF 2025 went live, thousands of players stormed the gates, the Discord server transformed into a marketplace of panic and memes, and somewhere in the background I was praying the infra wouldn‚Äôt spontaneously combust.

Spoiler: it didn‚Äôt.
Miracles do happen.

PerfectRoot CTF 2025 ‚Äî My Behind-the-Scenes Recap (Organized Chaos Done Right)

PerfectRoot CTF 2025 is officially in the books ‚Äî and wow, what a ride.
This year‚Äôs event wasn‚Äôt just bigger‚Ä¶ it was louder, faster, and way more chaotic in the best possible way. If last year was a warm-up jog, this year was a sprint uphill while juggling flaming Docker containers.

item.title: Marked by Dust - ADHoc Intel Walkthrough
item.description:
üïØÔ∏è Marked by Dust

Category: OSINT

‚ÄúTime has buried many secrets, but even in the dust, a precise place remains.‚Äù

The Question says:

Every place has its special words; find the ones that belong to this artifact

Prologue ‚Äî The Forgotten Door

It began with silence.
No coordinates, no hints ‚Äî only an image.
A sun-scorched door of ancient wood, framed in cracked earth, its texture heavy with history. It stared back at the solver like a memory half-recalled, daring them to look closer.

item.title: Dig Deeper Walkthrough - Dewald Roode Cybersecurity Hackathon 2025
item.description:
üï≥Ô∏è Prologue: Whispers Beneath the Noise

In the endless expanse of the cyber realm, secrets rarely scream ‚Äî they whisper. Steganography is the ancient art of these whispers: the delicate craft of hiding a truth so deeply that even when it is in plain sight, it remains unseen.

Where cryptography cloaks a message behind an unbreakable cipher, steganography conceals its very existence. A song that carries a confession in static. An image that smiles innocently while concealing a weapon beneath its pixels. A file that hums one story to the ear while hiding another for those patient enough to listen closer.

item.title: 3=crowd? - Bitwall CTF OSINT Walkthrough
item.description:
üï≥Ô∏è 3=crowd?

A journey into nothingness.

üïØÔ∏è Prologue

The screen flickered. No IP addresses to scan. No EXIF tags to scrub. No usernames to pivot from. Only a prompt:

‚ÄúAll through time, we have strived to achieve precision in all our workings.
Come our beloved cyberspace, and nothing became one of the most important fundamentals of the entire industry.
Trace back its true origin and describe in three words that which is known to all yet unknown to all.‚Äù

item.title: CyberDefenders: 3CX Supply Chain Attack
item.description:
Prologue: The Quiet Before the Storm

In the quietest moments of routine operations, danger often stirs. A trusted software update, something so mundane, becomes the entry point for a dark and malicious force. The 3CX Supply Chain Attack‚Äîan incident where trust was manipulated, and a seemingly harmless software update became a weapon of digital warfare. Prepare yourself, for the tale is one of hidden danger, covert movements, and the eerie calm before a storm. Let‚Äôs walk through this, step by step, through the veil of deceit and into the truth that lies beneath.

item.title: CyberDefenders: Oski Lab
item.description:
Prologue ‚Äî Into the Shadows

In the endless chess game between defenders and adversaries, sharpening one’s edge is a ritual as old as the hunt itself. Seeking to refresh my threat intelligence tradecraft, I turned to CyberDefenders, a playground for digital detectives, and selected a case that promised just the right dose of malice: Oski. Access it from here

Beneath its name lay the fragments of a malicious campaign, waiting to be pieced together ‚Äî a puzzle designed to challenge both observation and deduction. What began as an exercise would soon unravel into a tale of compromise, command, and control.

item.title: Behind The Curtain
item.description: It began on a night like any other‚Äîyet that night would alter everything. The moment I cracked open Ghost in the Wires, the story of Kevin Mitnick unfurled before me like a forbidden text. This wasn‚Äôt merely the tale of a hacker; this was the story of a man who understood something far more dangerous than any exploit or code‚Äîa man who mastered the art of influence. A man who knew how to manipulate reality itself.

item.title: HTB Sherlocks:Bumblebee Writeup
item.description:
HTB SHERLOCKS - BUMBLEBEE

Description

An external contractor has accessed the internal forum here at Forela via the Guest WiFi and they appear to have stolen credentials for the administrative user! We have attached some logs from the forum and a full database dump in sqlite3 format to help you in your investigation.

Files Attached

Solution

We shall use a DB Browser for SQLite to make analysis easier. This can be downloaded from https://sqlitebrowser.org/.

item.title: About
item.description:
I am Lord Sudo.

Red teamer. CTF tactician. Student of systems‚Äîand their failure points.
Proud operative of p3rf3ctr00t.

This space is not a blog. It is a ledger.
A chronicle of engagements, extractions, exploits‚Äîboth technical and psychological.

I navigate the unseen layers of digital infrastructure, where security is an illusion and silence is a weapon. Whether it’s code, configuration, or the human element‚Äîif it can be broken, it can be understood. And if it can be understood, it can be controlled.
